Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_sample_buffer_info

The function AIL_sample_buffer_info returns detailed information about the status of the double-buffering system for the specified sound handle.

S32 AIL_sample_buffer_info(
  HSAMPLE S,
  U32 *pos0,
  U32 *len0,
  U32 *pos1,
  U32 *len1
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle to check.

Out Parameters

pos0
will receive the current position of buffer 0.
len0
will receive the current size of buffer 0.
pos1
will receive the current position of buffer 1.
len1
will receive the current size of buffer 1.

Returns

Whether the double-buffering system has completely starved (both sound buffers have been exhausted).

Discussion

It is very rarely used - see AIL_sample_buffer_ready for a more useful status function.

You will probably never need this function. It is used primarily by video playback engines that need to monitor the double-buffer status in minute detail.

Do NOT use this function to determine when to load another sample buffer - use the AIL_sample_buffer_ready function instead.


Group: 2D Digital Audio Services
Related Functions: AIL_load_sample_buffer, AIL_minimum_sample_buffer_size, AIL_sample_buffer_ready
Related Basic Types: HSAMPLE, S32, U32
